data.title: Bones move without dependencies
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux Mint XFCE 18.2 (64_86x), Godot Engine 3.0.alpha.custom_build (8b362b50)
**Issue description:**
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5412322/27982887-944f0d22-63c8-11e7-9a21-40f8e3896a5b.png)
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5412322/27982876-49e77a26-63c8-11e7-8621-cd44c86ef52c.gif)
**Steps to reproduce:**
1) [Make skeleton](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/animation/cutout_animation.html#completing-the-skeleton)
2) [Add bones](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/animation/cutout_animation.html#skeletons) and [IK-bones](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/animation/cutout_animation.html#ik-chains)

data.title: macOS window resize draws everything black while resizing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS - Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
When resizing the window, everything is drawn black, when you finish it goes back to normal. This makes it hard to resize since you can't see anything.

In Windows this works as expected and draws correctly during the window resize


**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the game and resize the window by dragging the edges or corners.

data.title: OpenHMD for Godot 3.0
data.body:
This is a first pass at implementing the open source OpenHMD project into Godot based ontop of my ar_vr_server architecture.

I've taken a few shortcuts so there are a few improvements needed but for the most part this seems to work.

OpenHMD is an open source project that aims to bring cross platform VR headset support without the need for external drivers.
At this point in time OpenHMD only supports basic orientation tracking and no positional tracking but it does work with Rift, Vive and PSVR amongst others.

Output is to the main Godot window so it assumes you're mirroring your display and are running your application full screen.

data.title: Need a way to set a custom AABB per visual instance
data.body:
In latest Godot 3.0 I didn't find any function to set a custom AABB on MeshInstances and various other objects, except particles. It's useful to have this so that visuals transformed using shaders won't get culled wrongly.

I currently need it in my HeightMap module because all chunks of the map re-use the same mesh for memory efficiency, and the Y component of the vertices is offset in the vertex shader from a height map texture. But because the AABB of the mesh is still a flat zero Y, holes suddenly appear in the map because they get culled.

data.title: Editing external resources should not mark current edited scene as unsaved
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Antergos x86_64 - Godot master branch

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Expected: edited external *resource* to be marked as unsaved, not the *current scene*
Happened: the current scene is marked as unsaved, even one with no root node (empty) ~~which crashes the engine upon closing~~

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. New project
2. Open icon.png, change its name property. OR Audio > Set bus volume
3. The current scene tab is now `[empty](*)`, ~~closing it will crash the engine. (Fixed)~~

data.title: Gradient: improve interpolation?
data.body:
I asked a question on \#godotengine-devel (which nobody answers yet) about this image
[image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/27966753-9cfacf78-636a-11e7-85fd-779b178ffa15.png)

Top: pow(2) -> lerp -> sqrt
Bottom: current version (just lerp)
At least @karroffel thinks the top one blends better. 😛 

I'm not sure if my code will cause any performance issues. I only aim to bring this to core devs' attention.

(I have to admit I just watched [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LKnqECcg6Gw) and tried to implement it.)

data.title: [3.0] Editor crash when using a function with a string argument as a match pattern
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - [Godot-Windows-x86_64-2017-07-07.3f3deb0](https://bintray.com/version/files/calinou/godot/editor/2017-07-07.3f3deb0)

**Issue description:**
When using a function as a match pattern, the editor correctly tells you that you can't use functions in patterns, but as soon as you add a string as an argument within that function the editor crashes.

**Code example:**
```
func tester(arg = "bla"):
    match arg:
        begins_with("b"):
```
begins_with("b") is used as an example here but any function with a string argument crashes the editor too.

data.title: PhysicState.get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos is unusuable in 3D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot 2.1.4 (but I assume this behavior is probably much much older)
update: it's present in 7fc3c51169957f0907a13dd07d4004496e6ebd56 (3.0) as well

**Issue description:**
Recently I was looking at platformer 2d demo, and I saw very neat feature of PhysicState that allows to easily program following after movement floor parts like horizontal platforms in couple lines: (https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/blob/2.1/2d/platformer/player.gd#L221). 

```
if (found_floor):
	floor_h_velocity = s.get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos(floor_index).x
	lv.x += floor_h_velocity
```
![floor_velocity_2d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/27956828-ca354990-631b-11e7-82d4-3015dab24102.gif)



Immediately wanted to apply this to my 3d project where player movement is realized in quite similar fashion (also rigidbody), but it turns out it's not working so well in 3D.
This probably is somewhat know issue to @reduz since I looked at Platformer 3D demo, and very similar code is there... but it's turned off (commented): https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/blob/2.1/3d/platformer/player.gd#L169
![floor_velocity_3d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/27956837-d6aab872-631b-11e7-8636-35a9ebd2d125.gif)

Would be cool if we could have something similar in 3d, since at current moment this method is returning big forces even if terrain is perfectly static. 

**UPDATE 1:** For sample and more info check https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/9537#issuecomment-332870576

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download Platformer demo 3d and uncomment line 171 of Player script.

**Link to minimal example project:**
**Edit1:** For sample and more info check https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/9537#issuecomment-332870576

data.title: ScriptCreateDialog: fix open error crash, remember template
data.body:
Adds these features/fixes these issues (not reported, will link if found):
1. Can't use lowercase filename as template. (cc2cd20 😛)
2. Engine crash when template open error. (now show message box instead)
3. Template selector isn't updated when popup is reopen
4. Remember last chosen template
5. Fallback to Default if last chosen template is deleted

The current PR won't remember native script as it can't use template, allowing users to create native scripts while keeping the last used template of GDScript/VisualScript. This can be problematic when user wants to create many Native scripts in a row. This can be changed by adding codes in _lang_changed(). (But doing so, GDScript/VisualScript users will have to reselect template each time they create native script.)
WDYT? Should it be consistent (remember Native and the "Default template"), or the current behavior is fine as it is (don't remember for languages with no template support)?

data.title: 2.1.4-beta Area2D error on KinematicBody2D.queue_free()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian 9 - Godot 2.1.4-beta

**Issue description:**
I have a scene which have an Area2D node as root node, doing .queue_free() inside the "body_enter" signal logs this eror

> "Condition '!node' is true. Continuing..."

The error says is on "scene/2d/area2d.cpp:332" in "_clear_monitoring" function.

I also have a VisibilityNotifier2D node with an "exit_screen" signal, and I do .queue_free() there too, but it doesn't trigger the error.

**EDIT
------**

Seems it has nothing to do the bullet, it's the target that is throwing the error. Here is a demo project.

[Demo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1130945/Demo.zip)

data.title: Godot booth/talk/workshop on Kieler Open Source und Linux Tage?
data.body:
Hi,

I didn't find any contact information for the Godot project, so I try it here :-)

We are organising our 15th "Kieler Open Source und Linux Tage" (northern of Germany, www.kielux.de), a conference with 4 parallel tracks with talks and workshops and a smal exhibition for open source community projects and companies.

Is there anybody who would like to hold a talk and/or give a Godot workshop and/or make a booth on our event (14th - 16th September)?

Please answer by eMail to kontakt @ kilux.de .

PS Your register dialog for the forum seem to be broken. Says "Please re-read Terms of Service" but "I agree to the terms of service" was ticked and the TOS page was opened before. Tested with Firefox and Chromium.

Cu Hauke

data.title: server keyword for calling rpc on server
data.body:
I have some network code where the clients are the master and the server is but a slave. This is for my primary player controller class.

Now, often I'm finding I still want the server to be in control of a lot of things even though the each client is really the master.

I propose another keyword for gd script "server" which guarantees the rpc will only be called on the server regardless of who the master is.

data.title: graphical issues with material_tester demo [MESA, Linux]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Intel HD4000 (Mesa 17.1.4), Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
I ran into a couple of graphical issues (glitches?) running the new material tester demo.
see the attached screenshot for details.

1. The grid-like artifacts all over the place (especially visible in the lower left part of the image)
I suspect this is either a driver issue or a quality setting of sorts?

2. The cheese example has this strange lighting effect on top, if you zoom in, select the Lobby as a background and move the camera a specific way so the window is behind the cheese.
This doesn't look realistic, since cheese should neither reflect so much light nor let it pass through the material so much.

![cheese](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/27898961-9fe9fdf0-6228-11e7-8144-80cbd4c415da.png)

data.title: various issues with obj importer
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint and Win10


**Issue description:**
Bug 1: 
When obj meshes are imported there is a visible shading discontinuity along the uv seams. However the same mesh imported as a dae/collada is fine. The meshes have been exported from blender.
See project file and image below.

Bug 2:
Most likely related to the above issue, but while this model has no uv's, the vertex normal information is not importing from the obj correctly. It looks similar to if the model in blender has the "autosmooth" normals button turned off. That is, it has smooth shading on, but the normals are being auto detected rather than using the custom normals information. As a test I imported this obj (from blender) into Unity, Substance, Cinema 4d, Houdini as well as back into blender. They all imported it correctly.
See project file and image below.

Feature Request:
The ability to import material groups/polygon selections via the obj importer. Blender and other packages support obj export via the "material groups" flag in the exporter. This allows 2 or more polygon/material selections for a single mesh.

Ideally Godot would be able to import a single obj mesh into a scene and expose these material groups, in the same manner that dae import works. This would allow separate materials for each material group. As far as I can tell, the material selection poly faces are tagged in the .obj file and the .mtl is not actually required unless there is need for the actual material(color, spec, etc) information.

I have included a basic blender file with an object split into 3 material groups. These should import into blender as the same 3 groups, and with the color (red, green, blue) information if there is also a .mtl file. The .mtl file should be considered as optional, since the user may not need the original material properties just to get the material group selections. Having a .mtl for every .obj file could clutter up a project, so it should be up to the user.

![basic_obj_material_selections](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27942104-d93ba398-6317-11e7-83fd-ef56ef264b15.jpeg)
[basic_obj_material_selections.blend.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1129914/basic_obj_material_selections.blend.tar.gz)



**Steps to reproduce:**
Import an obj mesh and add material and environment.


**Link to minimal example project:**
Bug1: This scene shows a sphere on left imported as dae with no artifact. The sphere on right is from obj importer and shows the uv seam artifact.

![obj_seams](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27893421-e5f9ee16-6248-11e7-8a33-9dfdeca12e9a.jpeg)

[uvseam_test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1126607/uvseam_test.tar.gz)

Bug2: This screencap shows Blender(far left is the model as it should be with correct normals, next to it is the same model with "autosmooth" normals toggled off) and Godot3 (displaying the model imported as an obj with incorrect normal information). The zip file contains the blender file and the exported .obj

![cubish2_compare](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27981607-d0c19ab4-63d1-11e7-8893-14cbbed196a7.jpeg)

[cubish_obj_normals_comparison.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1132671/cubish_obj_normals_comparison.tar.gz)

data.title: Added a normalized offset parameter for all sprites
data.body:
Added a normalized offset parameter for all sprites, including all of the 3D sprites, named "anchor".
Closes #9490

I'm not totally sure the code for Sprite3D and AnimatedSprite3D is working, because I wasn't able to make a visible Sprite3D or AnimatedSprite3D for testing. I think the code works, but someone should probably look it over just to be sure.

Another thing I'm not sure about is having a use_anchor property for Sprite2D andAnimatedSprite2D. I had to included it for Sprite3D, which makes me think I probably should include it in Sprite2D and AnimatedSprite2D. What do you guys think?

data.title: removed floor so that global pos works with scale in control
data.body:
I had two issues with controls when using set_scale and set/get_global_position

Scaling a control to Vector2(3,3) and then setting the global_position to Vector2(6020,6020)
returned (60018,6018) on get_global_position
see #9464

Second problem was adding a (Vector <= scale value) to the global_position the result was no change at all in global_pos

This sloves both issues.

probably closes #6540

Some code if someone wants to try it

```
extends Control


func _ready():
	$ViewportContainer.set_scale(Vector2(3,3))
	
	print("Old Control: " + str(get_global_position()))
	
	print("Old Viewport: " + str($ViewportContainer.get_global_position()))
	
	print("Old Texture: " + str($ViewportContainer/TextureRect.get_global_position()))
	
	$ViewportContainer/TextureRect.set_global_position(Vector2(6020,6020))
	
	print("New Texture: " + str($ViewportContainer/TextureRect.get_global_position()))
	
	print("New Viewport: " + str($ViewportContainer.get_global_position()))
	
	print("New Control: " + str(get_global_position()))
#	set_process(true)
	
	
#func _fixed_process(delta):
#	$ViewportContainer/TextureRect.set_global_position($ViewportContainer/TextureRect.get_global_position()+Vector2(2,0))
#	print("New Texture: " + str($ViewportContainer/TextureRect.get_global_position()))
```

data.title: Control node enhancement
data.body:
After a discussion with @kubecz3k on the IRC, we came with several enhancements that could be made to the Control node. Most are inspired from the Unity Rect Transform component (https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/UIBasicLayout.html).

- [x] Add a pivot point for both rotation and scale
- [x] Replace anchors begin/center/end by a float value between 0 and 1 (should break compatibility :/) 
- [x] This probably means keeping the margin the same sign. For now the margin is set as the distance to the right side when anchored right. This should be negative, as it left to the right side.
- [x] Add a visualization for the anchor
- [x] Allow the anchors to be dragged
- [x] Add a vizualisation for the pivot point
- [x] Add a grow direction (Done, but I can't understand what this does... ^^) ?

Related: #5245, #5775, #4339, and maybe #7654, #8525, #2965

data.title: Unable to change position correctly in inspector if multiple node selected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 - 3.0 alpha

**Steps to reproduce:**
Select two different nodes with different X position,
change Y to some value
now two nodes are merged in first node's X and new Y

**Expected:**
Nodes are in different X and new Y

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4668980/27877726-750e58ce-61c4-11e7-950e-e4d2fe400833.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4668980/27877744-8c32046a-61c4-11e7-8414-b0740fd2f634.png)
